Package networkHandler

Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • networkHandler.Path
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Path>
    public class Path
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Path>

    This class represents a path of Nodes in a Graph.

    It consists of an ArrayList of Nodes sorted by their order of occurrence on the path and a length.

    Paths are also expandable by adding further Nodes and adding to their length.

    This class also implements the Comparable interface for easier recursive construction by the ShortestPathList class and sorting of paths.

    Note: this class has a natural ordering that is inconsistent with equals.

    Author:
    Fabian Grun

      • expand

        public void expand​(double length,
                   int NodeId)

        The method is used to expand a Path with another Node.

        The given Node is appended to the ArrayList of Nodes, while the length is set to the new given value.

        Parameters:
        length - New length of the Path
        NodeId - ID identifying the Node to append to the Path

      • contains

        public boolean contains​(int NodeId)
        This method check whether the Path contains a given Node.
        Parameters:
        NodeId - ID identifying the Node which is to be checked.
        Returns:
        boolean (true if Node lies on Path, otherwise false

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Path that)

        Implementation of the compareTo method inherited from the Comparable interface.

        Paths are sorted by their Origin Node (Index 0 in list) first, their destination Node second.

        If both origin and destination Node are equal, the number of Nodes on the path is used next ("shorter" paths before "longer") and if equal as well, the remaining Nodes on the path are compared.

        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Path>

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(Path that)
        This method is used to check two Paths for equality
        Parameters:
        that - another Path instance to be compared with the Path
        Returns:
        boolean, true if the Paths are equal, otherwise false

      • printToConsole

        public void printToConsole()
        This method prints the information of the Path as a String to the Console. The Information consists of the origin Node, the destination Node, the other Nodes on the Path in order and the length.
